db_description: This database is designed to store and manage all IT Service Management (ITSM) related data, including service requests, change management records, problem tracking logs, user profiles, asset details, and workflow histories. It serves as the core backend for maintaining the lifecycle of IT operations and support activities.

tables.name: request
tables.description: Central table that tracks IT service requests throughout their lifecycle. Contains comprehensive metadata including creation and update timestamps, assignment details, priority levels, and status transitions. Links to multiple reference tables like status, priority, and category to facilitate ticket classification, routing, and resolution. User relationships are maintained through requesterid and technicianid fields that reference flotouser table. SLA compliance is tracked through dueby field and status transitions.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Primary key that uniquely identifies each service request record. Used as reference target for task.refid when task.refmodel refers to requests. Follows system-wide numbering sequence for consistent tracking across the platform.

columns.name: updatedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who last modified the request. Essential for audit trail and accountability tracking. Updates automatically with each record modification.

columns.name: updatedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the request was last modified. Used for SLA calculations, aging reports, and audit trails. Automatically updated with each record change.

columns.name: createdtime
columns.description: Timestamp marking when the request was initially created. Critical for SLA calculation starting point and age-based metrics. Used extensively in time-based reports and performance analytics.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Unique identifier or reference code for the request that follows configured naming patterns. Often used in external communications and reporting. May contain auto-generated prefixes based on request category or department for easy identification.

columns.name: oobtype
columns.description: Out-of-Box type classification that determines the request's core behavior and available workflow actions. Predefined values control form layouts, available statuses, and automation rules. Essential for distinguishing between incident, service request, and other request categories.

columns.name: removed
columns.description: Logical deletion flag that marks a request as removed without physically deleting the record. When set to true, the request is hidden from standard views but retained for audit purposes. Supports data retention policies while maintaining referential integrity.

columns.name: approvalstatus
columns.description: Current state of the approval process for this request. Tracks multiple approval stages including pending, approved, rejected, and canceled states. Used by approval workflows to determine routing and notification rules. Critical for governance and authorization tracking.

columns.name: priorityid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to priority.id that determines the operational importance and response targets for this request. Influences SLA calculation, queue position, and escalation rules. May be automatically calculated based on impact and urgency values or manually assigned.

columns.name: requesterid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to flotouser.id identifying the user who submitted or is the beneficiary of this request. Used for communication, satisfaction surveys, and access control. Essential for request ownership and departmental reporting hierarchy.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Comprehensive text explaining the request details, including user-reported information and troubleshooting notes. May contain formatted text, embedded images, or attachment references. Searchable for knowledge base correlation and similar case identification.

columns.name: statusid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to status.id indicating the current position in the request lifecycle. Controls available actions, SLA calculation, and visibility in queues. Status transitions trigger workflow events, notifications, and time tracking metrics.

columns.name: technicianid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to flotouser.id identifying the support staff currently responsible for handling this request. Assignment changes are tracked for workload management and accountability. Critical for resource allocation, skills matching, and performance metrics.

columns.name: dueby
columns.description: Target resolution deadline timestamp calculated based on SLA definitions tied to request priority, category, and other attributes. Used for compliance tracking, escalation triggers, and performance reporting. May be automatically adjusted based on business hours, holidays, and status changes.

columns.name: urgencyid
columns.description: Foreign key reference indicating the time sensitivity of the request from the requester's perspective. Often combined with impact to automatically determine priority. Reflects how quickly a resolution is needed regardless of organizational impact.

columns.name: sourceid
columns.description: Foreign key reference identifying the channel through which the request was submitted (web portal, email, phone, chat, etc.). Influences routing rules, template selection, and channel-specific processing. Used for channel effectiveness and adoption reporting.

columns.name: spam
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the request has been identified as spam or unwanted communication. When enabled, the request may be filtered from standard queues and reports. Used primarily for email-originated requests that pass through spam detection systems.

columns.name: viprequest
columns.description: Indicator that this request requires priority handling due to the requester's organizational importance. VIP requests may bypass standard queuing rules, have custom SLA targets, and trigger special notifications. Often associated with executive management or critical business roles.

columns.name: subject
columns.description: Brief summary headline that describes the request's purpose or issue. Displayed in list views, notifications, and reports as the primary identifier. Should be concise while providing enough context to understand the request's nature without viewing details.

columns.name: categoryid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to category.id that classifies the request for routing, reporting, and knowledge association. Enables organization by technology, service, or issue type. Often presented in a hierarchical structure and may influence SLA targets and available resolution options.

columns.name: createdbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who created the request.

columns.name: approvaltype
columns.description: Type of approval process used for the request.

columns.name: departmentid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing department.id to indicate the department associated with the request.

columns.name: duetimemanuallyupdated
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the due by time was manually updated.

columns.name: firstresponsetime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the first response was provided for the request.

columns.name: groupid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing group.id to identify the group associated with the request.

columns.name: impactid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing impact.id to define the impact of the request.

columns.name: lastclosedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the request was last closed.

columns.name: lastopenedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the request was last opened.

columns.name: lastresolvedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the request was last resolved.

columns.name: lastviolationtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording the last time the SLA was violated for the request.

columns.name: locationid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing location.id to specify the location associated with the request.

columns.name: olddueby
columns.description: Previous due by timestamp for the request.

columns.name: oldresponsedue
columns.description: Previous response due timestamp for the request.

columns.name: originaldescription
columns.description: Original description of the request as initially submitted.

columns.name: reopened
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the request was reopened.

columns.name: resolutionduelevel
columns.description: Level of resolution due for the request.

columns.name: resolutionescalationtime
columns.description: Timestamp for when resolution escalation occurred.

columns.name: responsedue
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when a response is due for the request.

columns.name: responseduelevel
columns.description: Level of response due for the request.

columns.name: responsedueviolated
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the response due time was violated.

columns.name: responseescalationtime
columns.description: Timestamp for when response escalation occurred.

columns.name: slaviolated
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the SLA was violated for the request.

columns.name: statuschangedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the status of the request was last changed.

columns.name: supportlevel
columns.description: Level of support provided for the request.

columns.name: templateid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing template.id to specify the template used for the request.

columns.name: totalresolutiontime
columns.description: Total time taken to resolve the request.

columns.name: totalslapausetime
columns.description: Total time the SLA was paused for the request.

columns.name: totalworkingtime
columns.description: Total working time spent on the request.

columns.name: violatedslaid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing sla.id to identify the SLA that was violated.

columns.name: emailreadconfigemail
columns.description: Email address associated with the email read configuration.

columns.name: emailreadconfigid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing emailreadconfig.id to specify the email read configuration used for the request.

columns.name: purchaserequest
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the request is a purchase request.

columns.name: requesttype
columns.description: Type of request (e.g., incident, service request).

columns.name: servicecatalogid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing servicecatalog.id to identify the service catalog item associated with the request.

columns.name: totalonholdduration
columns.description: Total duration the request was on hold.

columns.name: removedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who removed the request.

columns.name: removedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the request was removed.

columns.name: callfrom
columns.description: Source from which the request originated (e.g., phone, email).

columns.name: groupchangedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the group associated with the request was last changed.

columns.name: lastolaviolationtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording the last time the OLA (Operational Level Agreement) was violated for the request.

columns.name: oladueby
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the OLA response is due for the request.

columns.name: olaviolated
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the OLA was violated for the request.

columns.name: oldoladueby
columns.description: Previous OLA due by timestamp for the request.

columns.name: askfeedbackdate
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when feedback was requested for the request.

columns.name: firstfeedbackdate
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when feedback was first received for the request.

columns.name: oladuelevel
columns.description: Level of OLA due for the request.

columns.name: olaescalationtime
columns.description: Timestamp for when OLA escalation occurred.

columns.name: suggestedcategoryid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing category.id to identify a suggested category for the request.

columns.name: suggestedgroupid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing group.id to identify a suggested group for the request.

columns.name: companyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing company.id to identify the company associated with the request.

columns.name: closedby
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who closed the request.

columns.name: resolvedby
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who resolved the request.

columns.name: vendorid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing vendor.id to identify the vendor associated with the request.

columns.name: lastucviolationtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording the last time the UC (Underpinning Contract) was violated for the request.

columns.name: olducdueby
columns.description: Previous UC due by timestamp for the request.

columns.name: totaluconholdduration
columns.description: Total duration the request was on hold based on UC.

columns.name: totalucpausetime
columns.description: Total time the UC was paused for the request.

columns.name: totalucworkingtime
columns.description: Total working time spent on the request based on UC.

columns.name: ucdueby
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the UC response is due for the request.

columns.name: ucduelevel
columns.description: Level of UC due for the request.

columns.name: ucescalationtime
columns.description: Timestamp for when UC escalation occurred.

columns.name: ucviolated
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the UC was violated for the request.

columns.name: violateducid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing uc.id to identify the UC that was violated.

columns.name: totalucresolutiontime
columns.description: Total time taken to resolve the request based on UC.

columns.name: transitionmodelid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing transitionmodel.id to specify the transition model used for the request.

columns.name: mergedrequest
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the request was merged with another request.

columns.name: migrated
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the request was migrated from another system.

columns.name: messengerconfigid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing messengerconfig.id to specify the messenger configuration used for the request.

columns.name: lastapproveddate
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the request was last approved.

tables.name: flotouser
tables.description: Core user repository that stores all system user profiles. Maintains hierarchical relationships through managerid field and organizational context via departmentid and locationid references. Controls system access through authentication parameters and access level settings. User records connect to multiple operational tables including requests, changes, problems, and tasks through various foreign key relationships. Contains essential contact information and preferences that support notification workflows and reporting.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Primary key uniquely identifying each user record. Referenced by multiple tables including request.requesterid, request.technicianid, and task.technicianid to establish user relationships throughout the system.

columns.name: updatedbyid
columns.description: Self-referencing foreign key to flotouser.id that identifies which administrator last modified this user record. Important for security audit trails and compliance reporting.

columns.name: updatedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the user record was last modified. Used for account maintenance auditing and security compliance reporting. Automatically updated on record changes.

columns.name: createdbyid
columns.description: Self-referencing foreign key to flotouser.id that identifies which administrator initially created this user account. Critical for account provisioning audit trails.

columns.name: createdtime
columns.description: Timestamp marking when the user account was initially created. Used for account lifecycle management, periodic review cycles, and security compliance reporting.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Full display name of the user, typically in "First Last" format. Used throughout the interface for identification in assignment fields, request lists, and audit trails. The primary human-readable identifier for the user account.

columns.name: oobtype
columns.description: Out-of-Box classification that determines the user record's behavior template and default permissions. Distinguishes between standard users, technicians, administrators, and system accounts. Influences available actions and default role assignments.

columns.name: removed
columns.description: Logical deletion marker that indicates the user account has been decommissioned without physically removing the database record. Preserves historical associations while preventing login and new assignments. Supports compliance with data retention policies.

columns.name: accesslevel
columns.description: Security classification determining base system access privileges independent of role assignments. Hierarchical levels control administrative capabilities, configuration access, and global permissions. Works in conjunction with role-based permissions for defense-in-depth security.

columns.name: authprovider
columns.description: Authentication mechanism used for this user account (local, LDAP, SAML, OAuth, etc.). Determines password policies, login workflows, and integration points. Critical for single sign-on functionality and security protocol compliance.

columns.name: contactno
columns.description: Primary telephone number for contacting the user. Used for SMS notifications, callback coordination, and emergency contact. May include extension information and be formatted according to regional standards.

columns.name: departmentid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to department.id that associates the user with their organizational unit. Influences request routing, approval hierarchies, and service catalog visibility. Used for organizational reporting and access control scoping.

columns.name: disabled
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user account is currently disabled, preventing login and system access.

columns.name: email
columns.description: Primary email address for the user, used for notifications, communication, and password resets.

columns.name: lastlogindate
columns.description: Timestamp recording the last successful login for the user account.

columns.name: ldapuser
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user account is managed through LDAP directory services.

columns.name: locationid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing location.id to specify the user's physical work location.

columns.name: managerid
columns.description: Self-referencing foreign key to flotouser.id identifying the user's direct manager or supervisor.

columns.name: signature
columns.description: Textual signature used in email communications and system notifications.

columns.name: userlogonname
columns.description: Username used for logging into the system.

columns.name: usertype
columns.description: Classification of user type, such as employee, contractor, or external user.

columns.name: lastpasswordchangedate
columns.description: Timestamp indicating the last time the user's password was changed.

columns.name: ldapconfigid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing ldapconfig.id to specify the LDAP configuration used for this user.

columns.name: originalsignature
columns.description: Original, unformatted signature of the user.

columns.name: passwordencrypted
columns.description: Encrypted password for the user account.

columns.name: realname
columns.description: User's real name, which may differ from the display name.

columns.name: reffilename
columns.description: Reference to a file associated with the user, such as a profile picture.

columns.name: timezone
columns.description: User's preferred timezone for displaying dates and times.

columns.name: verified
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user's email address has been verified.

columns.name: vip
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user is a VIP and requires special handling.

columns.name: donotdisturb
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user prefers not to be disturbed by notifications.

columns.name: failedloginattempts
columns.description: Number of failed login attempts for the user account.

columns.name: lastloginattemptdate
columns.description: Timestamp indicating the last failed login attempt for the user account.

columns.name: removedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who removed the user.

columns.name: removedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the user was removed.

columns.name: guestuser
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user is a guest user with limited privileges.

columns.name: pushnotificationtoken
columns.description: Token used for sending push notifications to the user's device.

columns.name: adlastresetpwdtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating the last time the user's password was reset in Active Directory.

columns.name: adlastunlockaccounttime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating the last time the user's account was unlocked in Active Directory.

columns.name: adresetpwdattempts
columns.description: Number of password reset attempts for the user in Active Directory.

columns.name: adunlockaccountattempts
columns.description: Number of account unlock attempts for the user in Active Directory.

columns.name: altcontactno1
columns.description: Alternate contact number 1 for the user.

columns.name: altcontactno2
columns.description: Alternate contact number 2 for the user.

columns.name: lastnotificationreadtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating the last time the user read their notifications.

columns.name: onetimepasswordforrequester
columns.description: Flag indicating whether a one-time password is required for the user when submitting requests.

columns.name: userlanguage
columns.description: User's preferred language for the application interface.

columns.name: coopsextensionnumber
columns.description: Extension number for CO-OPS users.

columns.name: coopsextensiontype
columns.description: Type of extension for CO-OPS users.

columns.name: coopsrole
columns.description: Role for CO-OPS users.

columns.name: allowtologin
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user is allowed to log in to the system.

columns.name: authenticationsource
columns.description: Source of authentication for the user (e.g., local, LDAP, SAML).

columns.name: ldapuserou
columns.description: LDAP user organizational unit.

columns.name: mfasecretcode
columns.description: Secret code used for multi-factor authentication.

columns.name: restrictedcompanyaccess
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user has restricted access to certain companies.

columns.name: allowdelegateapproval
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user is allowed to delegate approvals.

columns.name: allowdelegateapprovalteam
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user is allowed to delegate approvals to their team.

columns.name: ssoconfigid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing ssoconfig.id to specify the SSO configuration used for the user.

columns.name: ssouser
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user is an SSO user.

columns.name: enabledndschedule
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the Do Not Disturb schedule is enabled for the user.

columns.name: dndschedule_id
columns.description: Foreign key referencing dndschedule.id to specify the Do Not Disturb schedule for the user.

columns.name: dateformat
columns.description: User's preferred date format.

columns.name: datetimeformat
columns.description: User's preferred date and time format.

columns.name: timeformat
columns.description: User's preferred time format.

columns.name: cxouser
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user is a CXO user.

columns.name: availabilitystatusid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing availibilitystatus.id to specify the user's availability status.

columns.name: biometricauthentication
columns.description: Flag indicating whether biometric authentication is enabled for the user.

columns.name: lastpasswordexpirynotifytime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating the last time the user was notified about their password expiring.

columns.name: passwordexpirynotified
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user has been notified about their password expiring.

columns.name: allowworkdelegationforself
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user is allowed to delegate work for themselves.

columns.name: allowworkdelegationforteam
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the user is allowed to delegate work for their team.

columns.name: assetaccesslevel
columns.description: Level of access the user has to assets.

columns.name: blockedreason
columns.description: Reason the user is blocked, if applicable.

columns.name: anonymizestatus
columns.description: Status of the user's anonymization process.

columns.name: consentacceptedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the user accepted the consent agreement.

columns.name: customssoimportid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing customssoimport.id to specify the custom SSO import configuration used for the user.

columns.name: uuid
columns.description: Universally unique identifier for the user.

tables.name: status
tables.description: Reference table defining all possible status values across the ITSM platform. Supports workflow state management for requests, problems, changes, releases, and tasks through the statusid foreign key relationship. Hierarchical status structures are enabled through parentid self-referencing. Visual indicators are configured via colourcode attribute, while SLA calculation behaviors are controlled by slaoff flag. Statuses are grouped into logical stages represented by the statusstage field, enabling comprehensive workflow visualization and process control.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Primary key uniquely identifying each status definition. Referenced by multiple entity tables including request.statusid, change.statusid, and problem.statusid to indicate current state in respective workflows.

columns.name: updatedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to track which administrator last modified this status definition. Important for configuration change management and audit trails.

columns.name: updatedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the status definition was last modified. Used for configuration management history and audit compliance. Automatically updated with each record change.

columns.name: createdbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify which administrator originally created this status definition. Provides traceability for configuration management.

columns.name: createdtime
columns.description: Timestamp marking when the status definition was initially created. Used for configuration management history and lifecycle tracking of system definitions.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Human-readable label displayed in the interface for this status. Used in dropdown menus, request details, and reports. Should clearly communicate the request's current state to both technicians and requesters.

columns.name: oobtype
columns.description: Out-of-Box classification that defines the status's standard behavior and position in predefined workflows. Determines compatibility with system templates and automation rules. Distinguishes between custom and system-provided status values.

columns.name: removed
columns.description: Logical deletion marker that hides this status from active selection while preserving historical references. Prevents new records from using this status without breaking reporting on historical data. Supports configuration cleanup and simplification.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Detailed explanation of the status meaning, intended usage, and business implications. Used for admin reference and user training. Should include guidelines for when this status is appropriate and what actions should follow.

columns.name: isdefault
columns.description: Flag indicating this status is automatically assigned to new records when no explicit status is specified. Only one status per entity type can be marked as default. Essential for ensuring new records always have a valid workflow position.

columns.name: model
columns.description: Entity type or module for which this status is applicable (request, problem, change, etc.). Controls where the status appears in selection lists. Enables sharing the status table across multiple entity types while maintaining appropriate context separation.

columns.name: objorder
columns.description: Numeric value determining the display sequence of statuses in lists and dropdowns. Lower values appear first. Allows logical workflow organization (open states before closed states) regardless of creation date or alphabetical order.

columns.name: parentid
columns.description: Self-referencing foreign key to status.id that establishes hierarchical relationships between statuses. Enables status grouping and inheritance of properties. Supports complex workflow modeling with parent/child relationships for detailed tracking.

columns.name: colourcode
columns.description: Hexadecimal color value used for visual identification of this status in the user interface. Applied to status indicators, badges, and kanban boards. Helps users quickly identify record states through consistent color coding.

columns.name: slaoff
columns.description: Flag controlling whether SLA timers continue counting when a record is in this status. When enabled, SLA calculation is paused (such as when waiting for customer input). Critical for accurate service level measurement and compliance reporting.

columns.name: statusstage
columns.description: Broader workflow phase grouping multiple granular statuses (such as "In Progress" containing "Assigned", "Working", etc.). Used for simplified reporting, kanban views, and high-level workflow visualization. Provides macro-level process visibility.

columns.name: systemname
columns.description: Internal technical identifier used in business rules, workflows, and integrations. Unlike the display name, this remains consistent even if the user-facing label changes. Critical for maintaining automation rule stability and API compatibility.

columns.name: assetrequirescan
columns.description: Flag indicating whether an asset scan is required when the status is set.

columns.name: removedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who removed the status.

columns.name: removedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the status was removed.

columns.name: supportportalstatusname
columns.description: Name of the status as it appears in the support portal.

columns.name: ucoff
columns.description: Flag controlling whether UC (Underpinning Contract) timers continue counting when a record is in this status.

tables.name: priority
tables.description: Standardized priority classification reference table used across multiple entity types including requests, problems, changes, and tasks. Determines service level targets and operational response times when linked through priorityid foreign keys. Supports custom priority matrices with visual indicators via colourcode. Hierarchical priority structures can be defined through parentid self-referencing. Priority values influence resource allocation, escalation paths, and reporting metrics throughout the ITSM platform.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the priority.

columns.name: updatedbyid
columns.description: ID of the user who last updated the priority.

columns.name: updatedtime
columns.description: Timestamp when the priority was last updated.

columns.name: createdbyid
columns.description: ID of the user who created the priority.

columns.name: createdtime
columns.description: Timestamp when the priority was created.

columns.name: name
columns.description: User-facing label that identifies this priority level in the interface. Typically uses terms like "Critical", "High", "Medium", or "Low". Appears in dropdown selectors, request details, and reports to communicate urgency to all stakeholders.

columns.name: oobtype
columns.description: Out-of-Box classification that identifies standard priority levels versus custom organizational extensions. System-provided priorities have special handling for upgrades and patches. Helps distinguish between core priorities and organizational customizations.

columns.name: removed
columns.description: Logical deletion flag that hides this priority from active selection while preserving it for historical records. Allows priority scheme simplification without breaking existing records or reports. Supports configuration evolution over time.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Detailed explanation of when this priority should be assigned, including examples and impact criteria. Used for training, governance, and consistent application. Should clarify the business scenarios appropriate for this priority level.

columns.name: isdefault
columns.description: Flag indicating this priority is automatically assigned when no explicit value is provided. Only one priority per entity type can be marked as default. Ensures new records always have valid priority assignment for proper SLA calculation.

columns.name: model
columns.description: Entity type or module for which this priority is applicable (request, problem, change, etc.). Controls where the priority appears in selection lists. Enables sharing the priority table across multiple entity types with appropriate context separation.

columns.name: objorder
columns.description: Numeric value determining the display sequence in lists and dropdowns, and may also influence operational importance. Lower values typically represent higher priorities. Creates consistent ordering across all interfaces regardless of creation date or name.

columns.name: parentid
columns.description: Self-referencing foreign key to priority.id that establishes hierarchical relationships between priority levels. Supports complex priority matrices with parent/child relationships. Enables priority inheritance and grouping for specialized workflows.

columns.name: colourcode
columns.description: Hexadecimal color value used for visual identification of this priority in the interface. Applied to priority indicators, status boards, and reports. Creates intuitive visual urgency signals (red for critical, yellow for medium, etc.).

columns.name: systemname
columns.description: Internal technical identifier used in business rules, SLA definitions, and integrations. Provides stability for automation even if display names change. Critical for maintaining rule consistency and API compatibility across system updates.

columns.name: removedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who removed the priority.

columns.name: removedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the priority was removed.

tables.name: impact
tables.description: Reference table that quantifies the organizational effect of incidents, problems, and changes. Used in priority calculation matrices and risk assessments. Impact values are referenced by multiple operational tables through impactid foreign keys. Color-coded visual indicators are supported through the colourcode field. Hierarchical impact structures can be defined through parentid relationships. Impact classifications influence escalation paths, notification rules, and management reporting across the ITSM platform. There are 4 types of impact: Low, On Users, On Business, On Department.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Primary key uniquely identifying each impact level definition. Referenced by problem.impactid and used in matrix calculations for priority determination. Fundamental to incident classification and response prioritization.

columns.name: updatedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies which administrator last modified this impact definition. Important for governance of impact scheme changes that affect incident classification and priority matrices.

columns.name: updatedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the impact definition was last modified. Used for tracking configuration changes that might affect priority calculations. Essential for audit trails and change management documentation.

columns.name: createdbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies which administrator originally created this impact definition. Provides accountability for impact framework establishment and configuration governance.

columns.name: createdtime
columns.description: Timestamp marking when the impact definition was initially created. Used for impact scheme lifecycle tracking and configuration history. Helps establish timeline of impact definition evolution.

columns.name: name
columns.description: User-facing label that identifies this impact level in the interface. There are 4 types of impact: Low, On Users, On Business, On Department. Communicates the organizational scope affected by an incident or problem.

columns.name: oobtype
columns.description: Out-of-Box classification that distinguishes between standard impact levels and custom organizational extensions. System-provided impacts receive special handling during upgrades. Helps identify core configurations versus organizational customizations.

columns.name: removed
columns.description: Logical deletion flag that hides this impact level from active selection while preserving it for historical records. Allows impact scheme refinement without breaking existing records or reports. Supports configuration evolution over time.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Detailed explanation of this impact level's scope, affected user count thresholds, and business implications. Used for consistent application and training. Should provide clear criteria for determining when this impact level applies to a situation.

columns.name: isdefault
columns.description: Flag indicating this impact level is automatically assigned when no explicit value is provided. Only one impact per entity type can be default. Ensures new records always have valid impact assignment for proper priority calculation and reporting.

columns.name: model
columns.description: Entity type or module for which this impact level is applicable (incident, problem, change, etc.). Controls where the impact appears in selection lists. Enables sharing the impact table across multiple entity types with appropriate context separation.

columns.name: objorder
columns.description: Numeric value determining the display sequence and severity ranking in priority matrices. Lower values typically represent higher impacts. Creates consistent ordering across interfaces and establishes clear hierarchy for automation rules.

columns.name: parentid
columns.description: Self-referencing foreign key to impact.id that establishes hierarchical relationships between impact levels. Supports complex impact models with parent/child relationships. Enables impact inheritance and grouping for specialized assessment workflows.

columns.name: colourcode
columns.description: Hexadecimal color value used for visual identification of this impact level in the interface. Applied to impact indicators, matrices, and reports. Creates intuitive visual signals (red for enterprise-wide, yellow for departmental, etc.).

columns.name: systemname
columns.description: Internal technical identifier used in priority calculation matrices, business rules, and integrations. Provides stability for automation even if display names change. Critical for maintaining calculation consistency across system updates.

columns.name: removedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who removed the impact.

columns.name: removedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the impact was removed.

tables.name: department
tables.description: Organizational unit reference table used to define the structure of the enterprise. Each department represents a functional group (e.g., HR, IT, Finance) and is used for routing, assignment, reporting, and access control. Hierarchical relationships allow modeling of multi-level organizations. Used throughout ITSM for approvals, escalations, and user role scoping.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Primary key uniquely identifying each department entry. Serves as reference in user records, assignment groups, ticket ownership, and reporting hierarchy.

columns.name: updatedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies which administrator last modified this department record. Important for organizational structure change auditing and compliance documentation.

columns.name: updatedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the department record was last modified. Used for tracking organizational changes and structure evolution. Automatically updated with each record modification.

columns.name: createdbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies which administrator initially created this department. Critical for organizational governance and change management audit trails.

columns.name: createdtime
columns.description: Timestamp marking when the department was initially created in the system. Used for organizational history tracking and structural evolution mapping.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Official name of the department used for display throughout the interface. Appears in user profiles, assignment filters, and reports. Should align with formal organizational nomenclature for consistency.

columns.name: oobtype
columns.description: Out-of-Box classification that identifies predefined versus custom department types. System-provided departments receive special handling during upgrades. Distinguishes between core organizational units and customer-specific extensions.

columns.name: removed
columns.description: Logical deletion flag that hides this department from active selection while preserving historical references. Prevents reassignment to this department while maintaining data integrity for historical records. Supports organizational restructuring.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Detailed explanation of the department's function, responsibilities, and scope within the organization. Used for clarification in assignment interfaces and documentation. Helps users understand department purpose and service boundaries.

columns.name: objorder
columns.description: Numeric value determining the display sequence of departments in selection lists and organization charts. Lower values appear first. Creates consistent ordering across all interfaces regardless of creation date or alphabetical sorting.

columns.name: departmenthead
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies the manager or leader of this department. Used in approval workflows, escalation paths, and organizational reporting. Critical for establishing management responsibility and authority.

columns.name: parentid
columns.description: Self-referencing foreign key to department.id that establishes hierarchical organizational structure. Enables multi-level department trees reflecting organizational reporting lines. Essential for roll-up reporting and inherited access controls.

columns.name: removedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who removed the department.

columns.name: removedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the department was removed.

tables.name: location
tables.description: Geographic and physical site management table that maintains spatial organization of company assets and personnel. Referenced by flotouser.locationid to establish user site associations and by project.locationid for site-specific implementations. Hierarchical location structures are supported through self-referencing parentid relationship. GPS coordinates enable mapping integrations and geospatial analytics. The barcodeprefix field supports inventory and asset management workflows for location-specific item identification.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Primary key uniquely identifying each physical or geographic location. Referenced by flotouser.locationid and project.locationid to establish spatial context. Fundamental to location-based reporting and asset tracking.

columns.name: updatedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies which administrator last modified this location record. Important for tracking changes to site information and geospatial data. Part of the location management audit trail.

columns.name: updatedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the location information was last modified. Used for tracking facility changes and site evolution. Automatically updated with each record modification.

columns.name: createdbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies which administrator initially created this location. Essential for site management governance and expansion tracking.

columns.name: createdtime
columns.description: Timestamp marking when the location was initially defined in the system. Used for tracking organizational geographical expansion and site acquisition timelines.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Official name of the physical site or geographic location. Appears in user profiles, assignment filters, and location-based reports. Should use standardized naming conventions for consistency across the organization.

columns.name: oobtype
columns.description: Out-of-Box classification that differentiates between standard location types and custom site categories. Determines location behavior in templates and workflows. Helps distinguish between headquarters, branch offices, data centers, and other site types.

columns.name: removed
columns.description: Logical deletion flag that marks a location as decommissioned while preserving historical references. Prevents new assignments to this location while maintaining data integrity for historical records. Supports facility lifecycle management.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Detailed information about the location including address, contact details, operating hours, and special access instructions. Provides context for on-site support and service delivery. May include facility management contact information.

columns.name: objorder
columns.description: Numeric value determining the display sequence of locations in selection lists and geography hierarchies. Lower values appear first. Allows custom ordering separate from alphabetical sorting or creation date.

columns.name: parentid
columns.description: Self-referencing foreign key to location.id that establishes hierarchical geographic structures. Enables organization of locations by country, region, campus, building, and floor relationships. Essential for geographical roll-up reporting.

columns.name: barcodeprefix
columns.description: Location-specific identifier prefix used in asset tagging and inventory management. Creates unique identification patterns for items based on their physical location. Essential for asset tracking and automated inventory processes.

columns.name: latitude
columns.description: Geographic coordinate specifying north-south position of the location. Used with longitude for mapping, distance calculations, and geospatial analytics. Enables integration with mapping services and location-based workflows.

columns.name: longitude
columns.description: Geographic coordinate specifying east-west position of the location. Used with latitude for mapping, proximity analysis, and spatial reporting. Supports geographic visualization and location-aware service delivery.

columns.name: removedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who removed the location.

columns.name: removedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the location was removed.

tables.name: product
tables.description: Asset catalog table that documents technology products supported by the IT organization. Provides standardized product definitions for service catalog, asset management, and procurement processes. Linked to specific manufacturers through manufacturerid reference. Products are categorized via producttypeid for filtering and reporting. Serves as reference data for incident classification, problem analysis, and change impact assessment. Product records include identification information like part numbers to support inventory and license management.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Primary key uniquely identifying each product definition. Referenced by assets, purchases, and licenses throughout the system. Fundamental to configuration management and service catalog functionality.

columns.name: updatedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies which administrator last modified this product record. Important for product catalog governance and version control. Part of the configuration management audit trail.

columns.name: updatedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the product information was last updated. Used for tracking product definition evolution and catalog currency. Automatically updated with each record modification.

columns.name: createdbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies which administrator initially created this product record. Critical for product catalog management and procurement governance.

columns.name: createdtime
columns.description: Timestamp marking when the product was initially added to the catalog. Used for tracking product lifecycle and support timeline commencement. Important for warranty and support entitlement.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Internal system name of the product used for database operations and integrations. May differ from the user-facing display name. Should follow consistent naming conventions for system processing.

columns.name: oobtype
columns.description: Out-of-Box classification that identifies standard product types versus custom catalog entries. Determines product behavior in templates and workflows. Helps distinguish between hardware, software, services, and bundle product types.

columns.name: removed
columns.description: Logical deletion flag that marks a product as discontinued while preserving references in existing assets and historical data. Prevents new procurement of this product while maintaining data integrity for deployed instances.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Comprehensive product information including capabilities, specifications, and support details. Displayed in service catalog and asset information screens. Provides technical context for support staff and request fulfillment teams.

columns.name: displayname
columns.description: User-friendly product name shown in interfaces, reports, and service catalog. May include branding elements and marketing terminology. Often more descriptive than the internal system name for better user recognition.

columns.name: manufacturerid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to the vendor.id of the product manufacturer. Establishes brand relationship and support channel information. Essential for warranty claims, patch management, and vendor-specific workflows.

columns.name: partnumber
columns.description: Manufacturer's unique identifier for the product or SKU. Used for procurement, warranty lookups, and vendor communications. Critical for ensuring correct product specification during ordering and fulfillment.

columns.name: producttypeid
columns.description: Foreign key reference that categorizes the product within the organizational taxonomy. Controls lifecycle workflows, depreciation rules, and management processes. Distinguishes between hardware, software, consumables, and services.

columns.name: removedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who removed the product.

columns.name: removedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the product was removed.

tables.name: change
tables.description: Change management tracking table that documents planned modifications to IT services and infrastructure. Implements formal change control processes with approval workflows, risk assessment, and implementation planning. Links to reference tables via statusid, priorityid, categoryid, and risktypeid for comprehensive change classification. Assignment relationships are maintained through technicianid (implementer) and changemanager (oversight) references to flotouser. Change records can be associated with requests, problems, and releases through relationship tables. Scheduling and timeline tracking is facilitated through startdate and enddate fields.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Primary key uniquely identifying each change record. Referenced by tasks, approvals, and implementation plans. Forms the central identifier for all change management processes and documentation.

columns.name: updatedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies which user last modified this change record. Critical for change governance and audit requirements. Helps establish accountability for change documentation currency.

columns.name: updatedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the change record was last modified. Used for change activity tracking and communication timeliness. Automatically updated with each record modification and workflow state transition.

columns.name: createdbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies which user initially submitted this change request. Important for determining change origination and initial requirements ownership.

columns.name: createdtime
columns.description: Timestamp marking when the change was initially requested. Used for measuring change lead time and planning effectiveness. Starts the clock for change management process metrics and SLA measurement.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Unique reference code or identifier displayed in communications, reports, and tracking systems. Often follows a specific numbering pattern like "CHG-10001". The primary human-readable identifier for the change.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Comprehensive documentation of the change purpose, scope, implementation details, and rollback procedures. Core component of change documentation used by implementers and approvers. Should include technical specifications and business justification.

columns.name: statusid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to status.id indicating the current position in the change lifecycle. Controls available actions, approval gates, and visibility in change calendars. Change Advisory Board (CAB) reviews often trigger status transitions.

columns.name: priorityid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to priority.id determining the change's operational importance and scheduling precedence. Influences review urgency, resource allocation, and implementation scheduling. Reflects business impact of delay versus risk.

columns.name: technicianid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to flotouser.id identifying the primary implementer responsible for executing the change. Accountable for technical feasibility and execution quality. Distinct from the change manager who provides oversight.

columns.name: requesterid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to flotouser.id identifying who requested or sponsored the change. Responsible for business justification and benefits realization. Often consulted for requirements clarification and acceptance testing.

columns.name: categoryid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to category.id that classifies the change by technology, service, or component affected. Determines routing to specialized review boards and required approval workflows. Supports change filtering and trend analysis.

columns.name: changemanager
columns.description: Foreign key reference to flotouser.id identifying the designated change coordinator who oversees the process. Responsible for documentation completeness, stakeholder communication, and procedure adherence. Ensures proper governance throughout the change lifecycle.

columns.name: risktypeid
columns.description: Foreign key reference that indicates the assessed risk level of implementing this change. Influences approval requirements, testing scope, and scheduling restrictions. Higher risk changes typically require more comprehensive review and planning.

columns.name: changetypeid
columns.description: Foreign key reference categorizing the nature of the change (standard, normal, emergency, etc.). Determines the process workflow, approval requirements, and documentation levels. Standard changes may follow expedited paths with reduced governance.

columns.name: startdate
columns.description: Planned implementation commencement timestamp that appears in change calendars and resource schedules. Used for conflict detection with other changes and maintenance windows. Critical for change collision prevention and communication.

columns.name: enddate
columns.description: Planned implementation completion timestamp that defines the expected conclusion of change activities. Used for resource allocation, service disruption communications, and SLA suspension periods. Helps measure implementation efficiency.

columns.name: oobtype
columns.description: Out-of-Box classification that defines the change record's standard behavior and default settings.

columns.name: removed
columns.description: Logical deletion marker that indicates the change record has been decommissioned without physically removing the database record.

columns.name: approvalstatus
columns.description: Current status of the approval process for the change (e.g., pending, approved, rejected).

columns.name: approvaltype
columns.description: Type of approval required for the change (e.g., CAB, Manager).

columns.name: departmentid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing department.id to associate the change with a specific department.

columns.name: dueby
columns.description: Timestamp indicating the deadline for completing the change.

columns.name: duetimemanuallyupdated
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the due by time was manually updated.

columns.name: firstresponsetime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the first response was provided for the change.

columns.name: groupid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing group.id to identify the group associated with the change.

columns.name: impactid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing impact.id to define the impact of the change.

columns.name: lastclosedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the change was last closed.

columns.name: lastopenedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the change was last opened.

columns.name: lastresolvedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the change was last resolved.

columns.name: lastviolationtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording the last time the SLA was violated for the change.

columns.name: locationid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing location.id to specify the location associated with the change.

columns.name: olddueby
columns.description: Previous due by timestamp for the change.

columns.name: oldresponsedue
columns.description: Previous response due timestamp for the change.

columns.name: originaldescription
columns.description: Original description of the change as initially submitted.

columns.name: reopened
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the change was reopened.

columns.name: resolutionduelevel
columns.description: Level of resolution due for the change.

columns.name: resolutionescalationtime
columns.description: Timestamp for when resolution escalation occurred.

columns.name: responsedue
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when a response is due for the change.

columns.name: responseduelevel
columns.description: Level of response due for the change.

columns.name: responsedueviolated
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the response due time was violated.

columns.name: responseescalationtime
columns.description: Timestamp for when response escalation occurred.

columns.name: slaviolated
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the SLA was violated for the change.

columns.name: statuschangedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the status of the change was last changed.

columns.name: subject
columns.description: Subject line or title of the change.

columns.name: supportlevel
columns.description: Level of support provided for the change.

columns.name: templateid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing template.id to specify the template used for the change.

columns.name: totalresolutiontime
columns.description: Total time taken to resolve the change.

columns.name: totalslapausetime
columns.description: Total time the SLA was paused for the change.

columns.name: totalworkingtime
columns.description: Total working time spent on the change.

columns.name: urgencyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing urgency.id to define the urgency of the change.

columns.name: violatedslaid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing sla.id to identify the SLA that was violated.

columns.name: approvalendtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the approval process ended.

columns.name: approvalstarttime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the approval process started.

columns.name: changeimplementor
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify the change implementor.

columns.name: changereviewer
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify the change reviewer.

columns.name: closeendtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the closing process ended.

columns.name: closestarttime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the closing process started.

columns.name: implementationendtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the implementation process ended.

columns.name: implementationstarttime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the implementation process started.

columns.name: planningendtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the planning process ended.

columns.name: planningstarttime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the planning process started.

columns.name: prevstatusid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing status.id to indicate the previous status of the change.

columns.name: reasontype
columns.description: Type of reason for the change.

columns.name: reviewendtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the review process ended.

columns.name: reviewstarttime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the review process started.

columns.name: rolloutdateendtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the rollout date ended.

columns.name: rolloutdatestarttime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the rollout date started.

columns.name: submittedendtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the submission process ended.

columns.name: submittedstarttime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the submission process started.

columns.name: targetenvironment
columns.description: Target environment for the change (e.g., production, test).

columns.name: watcher_id
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify a watcher for the change.

columns.name: totalonholdduration
columns.description: Total duration the change was on hold.

columns.name: removedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who removed the change.

columns.name: removedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the change was removed.

columns.name: groupchangedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the group associated with the change was last changed.

columns.name: lastolaviolationtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording the last time the OLA (Operational Level Agreement) was violated for the change.

columns.name: oladueby
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the OLA response is due for the change.

columns.name: olaviolated
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the OLA was violated for the change.

columns.name: oldoladueby

columns.name: oladuelevel
columns.description: Level of OLA due for the change.

columns.name: olaescalationtime
columns.description: Timestamp for when OLA escalation occurred.

columns.name: companyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing company.id to identify the company associated with the change.

columns.name: vendorid

columns.name: lastucviolationtime

columns.name: olducdueby

columns.name: totaluconholdduration
columns.description: Total duration the change was on hold based on UC.

columns.name: totalucpausetime
columns.description: Total time the UC was paused for the change.

columns.name: totalucworkingtime
columns.description: Total working time spent on the change based on UC.

columns.name: ucdueby

columns.name: ucduelevel
columns.description: Level of UC due for the change.

columns.name: ucescalationtime
columns.description: Timestamp for when UC escalation occurred.

columns.name: ucviolated

columns.name: violateducid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing uc.id to identify the UC that was violated.

columns.name: totalucresolutiontime
columns.description: Total time taken to resolve the change based on UC.

columns.name: transitionmodelid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing transitionmodel.id to specify the transition model used for the change.

columns.name: migrated
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the change was migrated from another system.

columns.name: lastapproveddate
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the change was last approved.

tables.name: release
tables.description: Release management table that coordinates the deployment of multiple changes as unified packages. Ensures controlled delivery of software updates and infrastructure modifications to production environments. Classification is provided through references to status, priority, category, and risk tables. Key stakeholders are identified via technicianid, requesterid, and releasemanager references to flotouser. Release planning and execution are managed through startdate and enddate scheduling. Release packages typically contain multiple change records and associated tasks for implementation steps. Supports major, minor, and emergency release classification through releasetypeid.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Primary key uniquely identifying each release package record. Serves as the central reference for all components, changes, and tasks associated with this coordinated deployment. Core identifier for release management processes.

columns.name: updatedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies which user last modified this release record. Important for release governance and audit requirements. Tracks ongoing refinement of release documentation and planning.

columns.name: updatedtime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the release information was last modified. Used for tracking release planning evolution and documentation currency. Updated automatically with each record modification and status change.

columns.name: createdbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id that identifies which user initially defined this release package. Important for establishing release ownership and accountability at inception. Typically a release or product manager.

columns.name: createdtime
columns.description: Timestamp marking when the release was initially defined and planning commenced. Used for measuring release preparation lead time and overall release lifecycle duration. Starting point for release effectiveness metrics.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Unique identifier or version code that follows organizational release naming conventions (e.g., "R22.4" or "Winter Release 2023"). Used in communications, documentation, and tracking. The primary human-readable release identifier.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Comprehensive documentation of the release scope, components, dependencies, and business objectives. Used by implementation teams, testers, and stakeholders. Should include both technical details and business value statements.

columns.name: statusid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to status.id indicating the current position in the release lifecycle. Controls available actions, approval gates, and reporting. Reflects stages like planning, building, testing, deploying, and reviewing.

columns.name: priorityid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to priority.id determining the release's business importance and resource allocation precedence. Influences scheduling, conflict resolution, and escalation paths. Reflects strategic value versus tactical urgency.

columns.name: technicianid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to flotouser.id identifying the lead technical resource responsible for implementation aspects. Ensures technical feasibility, integration, and component compatibility. Works closely with the release manager.

columns.name: requesterid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to flotouser.id identifying the business sponsor or product owner who requested this release. Accountable for requirements definition and business value realization. Typically authorizes scope changes.

columns.name: categoryid
columns.description: Foreign key reference to category.id that classifies the release by product line, service area, or business domain. Determines specialized review requirements and testing approaches. Supports release filtering and reporting.

columns.name: releasemanager
columns.description: Foreign key reference to flotouser.id identifying the designated release coordinator who orchestrates the entire process. Responsible for integration, scheduling, resource management, and stakeholder communication. The primary owner of release success.

columns.name: risktypeid
columns.description: Foreign key reference indicating the assessed risk level of this release deployment. Determines required testing depth, fallback planning, and approval thresholds. Higher risk releases typically involve more extensive controls and verification.

columns.name: releasetypeid
columns.description: Foreign key reference categorizing the nature and scope of the release (major, minor, emergency, etc.). Controls process workflow, documentation requirements, and release cycle positioning. Major releases typically follow full lifecycle while emergency releases may be expedited.

columns.name: startdate
columns.description: Planned deployment commencement timestamp appearing in release calendars and blackout schedules. Used for resource coordination, downtime notifications, and dependency management. Critical for sequencing multiple release components.

columns.name: enddate
columns.description: Planned deployment completion timestamp marking the expected conclusion of release activities and return to normal operation. Used for scheduling post-implementation reviews and hypercare support periods. Defines the release window boundary.

columns.name: oobtype
columns.description: Out-of-Box classification that defines the release record's standard behavior and default settings.

columns.name: removed
columns.description: Logical deletion marker that indicates the release record has been decommissioned without physically removing the database record.

columns.name: removedbyid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing flotouser.id to identify who removed the release.

columns.name: removedtime
columns.description: Timestamp indicating when the release was removed.

columns.name: approvalstatus
columns.description: Current status of the approval process for the release (e.g., pending, approved, rejected).

columns.name: approvaltype
columns.description: Type of approval required for the release (e.g., CAB, Manager).

columns.name: departmentid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing department.id to associate the release with a specific department.

columns.name: dueby
columns.description: Timestamp indicating the deadline for completing the release.

columns.name: duetimemanuallyupdated

columns.name: firstresponsetime
columns.description: Timestamp recording when the first response was provided for the release.

columns.name: groupid
columns.description: Foreign key referencing group.id to identify the group associated with the release.

columns.name: impactid

columns.name: prevstatusid

columns.name: qamanager

columns.name: releaseengineer

columns.name: releasereviewer

columns.name: rolloutdatestarttime

columns.name: watcher_id

columns.name: totalucresolutiontime

columns.name: transitionmodelid

columns.name: migrated

columns.name: lastapproveddate
